tit.cmt: 次のパラグラフの冒頭に「（ごぼうせい、英語：Pentagram）」とあるので、こちらの英訳を採用しました。

sen.j: 五芒星（ごぼうせい、英語：Pentagram）または五芒星形・五角星形・五線星型・星型五角形・正5/2角形は、互いに交差する、長さの等しい5本の線分から構成される図形で星型正多角形の一種である。
sen.e: Gobosei (pentacle) mark (Pentagram in English) or Gobosei shape/five-pointed star shape/五線星型/star-shaped pentagon/正5/2角形 is a figure consisting of five lines of equal length that are mutually intersected, and is one kind of star-shaped regular polygon.
sen.cmt: 五線星型・正5/2角形の用語は不明です。
sen.e: Gobosei (Pentagram) is a figure consisting of five lines of equal length that are mutually intersected, and is one kind of star-shaped regular polygon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Gobosei (Pentagram) is a figure consisting of five lines of equal length that are mutually intersected, and is one kind of star-shaped regular polygon.

sen.j: 五芒星は、五芒星形・五角星形・五線星型・星型五角形・正5/2角形とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also known as Gobosei shape, five-pointed star shape, 五線星型, star-shaped pentagon, 正5/2角形.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is also known as Gobosei shape, five-pointed star shape, 五線星型, star-shaped pentagon, 正5/2角形.

sen.j: 五角形正五角形に内接し、対称的である。
sen.e: It is inscribed in pentagon/regular pentagon, and is symmetrical.
It is inscribed in regular pentagon, and is symmetrical.
sen.cmt: Wikipedia の対応ページを確認すると、「五角形正五角形に内接し、」の部分は、「正五角形に内接し、」となっていますので、修正しました。
sen.e: It is inscribed in regular pentagon, and is symmetrical.

sen.j: 一筆書きが可能。
sen.e: It is unicursal.
It is unicursal.
It is unicursal.

sen.j: 5つの要素を並列的に図案化できる図形として、洋の東西を問わず使われてきた。
sen.e: It has been used in all countries as a figure that can design five elements in parallel.
It has been used in all countries as a figure that can design five elements in parallel.
It has been used in all countries as a figure that can design five elements in parallel.

sen.j: 世界中で魔術の記号として用いられる。
sen.e: It has been used as an occult mark throughout the world.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It has been used as an occult mark throughout the world.
It has been used as an occult mark throughout the world.

sen.j: 扱い方一つで守護に用いることもあれば、上下を逆向きにして悪魔の象徴になることもある。
sen.e: Depending on the usage, it can be used as protection, or it can symbolize the devil, when it is placed upside down.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Depending on the usage, it can be used as protection, or it can symbolize the devil, when it is placed upside down.
Depending on the usage, it can be used as protection, or it can symbolize the devil, when it is placed upside down.

sen.j: 悪魔の象徴としてとらえる際には、デビルスターと呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: When it is regarded as the symbol of the devil, it is sometimes called a devil star.
When it is regarded as the symbol of the devil, it is sometimes called a devil star.
When it is regarded as the symbol of the devil, it is sometimes called a devil star.

sen.j: また、外側の5つの三角形が星の光彩を連想させる事から、星を表す記号としてよく用いられる。
sen.e: Further, it is often used as a mark representing a star, because the outer five triangles are associated with the glitter of a star.
Further, it is often used as a mark representing a star, because the outer five triangles are associated with the glitter of a star.
Further, it is often used as a mark representing a star, because the outer five triangles are associated with the glitter of a star.

sen.j: 内側に生じる小さな正五角形を取り除いた形（☆：五光星）もしばしば五芒星と呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: The shape without the inner small regular pentagon (☆ - five-pointed star) is often called Gobosei.
sen.cmt: 五光星の用語は未確認ですが、five-pointed starとしました。
sen.e: The shape without the inner small regular pentagon (☆: five-pointed star) is often called Gobosei.
sen.cmt: ☆マークの後ろの - (ハイフン) は、続く "five-pointed star" の部分にもハイフンが含まれて、区切りとしての意味がはっきりしないため、原文どおりコロンにしました。
sen.e: The shape without the inner small regular pentagon (five-pointed star) is often called Gobosei.

sen.j: 五芒星を描く向きには、下記のように2通りがよくみられる。
sen.e: There are usually two directions to draw the Gobosei (pentacle) mark.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There are usually two directions to draw the Gobosei.
sen.cmt: 初出ではないので、"Gobosei" のみでよいと判断しました。
sen.e: There are usually two directions to draw the Gobosei.

sen.j: 右上の図のように1角が上を向くようにする方法（しばしば「上向き」と呼ばれる）。
sen.e: One is to make one point upward (often called "upright pentagram, "as shown in the upper right figure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処, 上向き五芒星はhttp://www.religioustolerance.org/wic_pent.htmを参照。
sen.e: One is to make one point upward (often called "upright pentagram, "as shown in the upper right figure.
One is to make one point upward (often called "upright pentagram, "as shown in the upper right figure.

sen.j: そして、これを36度 (角度)回転させて得られる、2角が上を向くようにする方法（しばしば「下向き」と呼ばれる）である。
sen.e: The other is to make the two points upward by rotating it by 36 degree (angle) (often called "downward").
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処、下向き五芒星は不明でしが、上記サイトにinverted pentagramというのがあります。しかし、特定できませんので、downwardとしました。
sen.e: The other is to make the two points upward by rotating it by 36 degree (angle) (often called "downward pentagram").
sen.cmt: 直前の文に合わせて、 "downward pentagram" としました。
sen.e: The other is to make the two points upward by rotating it by 36 degree (angle) (often called 'downward pentagram').

sen.j: いずれを用いるかは歴史的には一定していないが、近年では上向きのほうが多く用いられる。
sen.e: It is not constant in history which one is used, but the upright one has been more frequently used in recent years.
It is not constant in history which one is used, but the upright one has been more frequently used in recent years.
It is not constant in history which one is used, but the upright one has been more frequently used in recent years.

sen.j: また、描き順には文化的な意味が割り当てられている。
sen.e: Further, a cultural meaning is added in the order of drawing.
Further, a cultural meaning is added in the order of drawing.
Further, a cultural meaning is added in the order of drawing.
It uses 1 1.618.
In the figure, the ratio of length of blue line and red line, green line and blue line, and purple line and green line are equally 1 : 1+√5/2 = 1 : 1.168...
sen.cmt: Wikipedia のネット上のページを確認すると、この部分の原文は、「図において、青の線分と赤の線分の長さの比、同じく緑と青の比、紫と緑の比は一定の値 1 : 1+√5/2 = 1 : 1.168... を取る。」となっていましたので、その訳文に修正しました。
sen.e: In the figure, the ratio of length of blue line and red line, green line and blue line, and purple line and green line are equally 1 : 1+√5/2 = 1 : 1.168...

sen.j: これは黄金比と等しい。
sen.e: This is equal to golden ratio.
This is equal to golden ratio.
This is equal to golden ratio.

sen.j: 古くから黄金比で構成されている図形は美しいとされている。
sen.e: Figures made with the golden ratio have been considered beautiful since ancient times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Figures made with the golden ratio have been considered beautiful since ancient times.
Figures made with the golden ratio have been considered beautiful since ancient times.

sen.j: 単純ながらも黄金比を数多く含む五芒星は美しい図形の代表格とされた。
sen.e: The Gobosei (pentacle) mark containing a number of golden ratios, in spite of its simplicity, was considered to be representative of beautiful figures.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Gobosei containing a number of golden ratios, in spite of its simplicity, was considered to be representative of beautiful figures.
sen.cmt: 初出ではないので、"Gobosei" のみでよいと判断しました。
sen.e: The Gobosei containing a number of golden ratios, in spite of its simplicity, was considered to be representative of beautiful figures.

sen.j: デンマークのカステレット要塞、北海道の五稜郭、長崎市の市町村章は五芒星を元にしている。
sen.e: Kastellet fortress in Denmark, Goryokaku in Hokkaido, and the municipal emblem of Nagasaki City are based on the Gobosei (pentacle) mark.
Kastellet fortress in Denmark, Goryokaku in Hokkaido, and the municipal emblem of Nagasaki City are based on the Gobosei.
sen.cmt: 初出ではないので、"Gobosei" のみでよいと判断しました。
sen.e: Kastellet fortress in Denmark, Goryokaku in Hokkaido, and the municipal emblem of Nagasaki City are based on the Gobosei.

tit.j: 陰陽道と安倍晴明の桔梗印
tit.e: Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements), and the Chinese Bellflower Crest of ABE no Seimei
Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements), and the Chinese Bellflower Crest of ABE no Seimei
Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements), and the Chinese Bellflower Crest of ABE no Seimei

sen.j: 五芒星は、陰陽道では魔除けの呪符として伝えられている。
sen.e: In Onmyodo, the Gobosei (pentacle) mark has been handed down as the talisman to ward off evil spirits.
In Onmyodo, the Gobosei has been handed down as the talisman to ward off evil spirits.
sen.cmt: 初出ではないので、"Gobosei" のみでよいと判断しました。
sen.e: In Onmyodo, the Gobosei has been handed down as the talisman to ward off evil spirits.

sen.j: 印にこめられたその意味は、陰陽道の基本概念となった陰陽五行説、木・火・土・金・水の五つの元素の働きの相克を表したものである。
sen.e: The meaning contained in the mark is that it represents the rivalry of the functions of the five elements (wood, fire, earth, metal, and water) in Onmyo-gogyo-setsu (The Theory of Five Elements), which formed the basis of Onmyodo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The meaning contained in the mark is that it represents the rivalry of the functions of the five elements (wood, fire, earth, metal, and water) in Onmyo-gogyo-setsu (The Theory of Five Elements), which formed the basis of Onmyodo.

The meaning contained in the mark is that it represents the rivalry of the functions of the five elements (wood, fire, earth, metal, and water) in Onmyo-gogyo-setsu (The Theory of Five Elements), which formed the basis of Onmyodo.

sen.j: 五芒星はあらゆる魔除けのお札として重宝された。
sen.e: The Gobosei (pentacle) mark was useful for ofuda (paper charm) to ward off all kinds of evils.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Gobosei was useful for ofuda (paper charm) to ward off all kinds of evils.
sen.cmt: 初出ではないので、"Gobosei" のみでよいと判断しました。
sen.e: The Gobosei was useful for ofuda (paper charm) to ward off all kinds of evils.

sen.j: 日本の平安時代の陰陽師、安倍晴明は五行思想の象徴として、五芒星の紋を用いた。
sen.e: ABE no Seimei, Onmyoji (Master of Yin yang) in the Heian period in Japan used the crest of Gobosei as the symbol of Gogyo shiso (Five Elements Theory).
ABE no Seimei, Onmyoji (Master of Yin yang) in the Heian period in Japan used the crest of Gobosei as the symbol of Gogyo shiso (Five Elements Theory).
ABE no Seimei, Onmyoji (Master of Yin yang) in the Heian period in Japan used the crest of Gobosei as the symbol of Gogyo shiso (Five Elements Theory).

sen.j: キキョウの花の形との類似から、この紋は晴明桔梗紋などと呼ばれる。
sen.e: As the crest looks like a Chinese bellflower, it is called the Seimei bellflower crest.
As the crest looks like a Chinese bellflower, it is called the Seimei bellflower crest.
As the crest looks like a Chinese bellflower, it is called the Seimei bellflower crest.

sen.j: 現在も晴明神社の神紋などにみることができる。
sen.e: It can be seen in the sacred emblem of Seimei-jinja Shrine even today.
It can be seen in the sacred emblem of Seimei-jinja Shrine even today.
It can be seen in the sacred emblem of Seimei-jinja Shrine even today.

sen.j: セーマンドーマンも参照。
sen.e: See Semandoman.
See Semandoman.
See Semandoman.

sen.j: 准士官が正装・礼装時に着用する軍服 (大日本帝国陸軍)正装（大礼服）の正帽の天井には、金線（銀線）で五芒星が刺繍されていた。
sen.e: A Gobosei (pentacle) mark was embroidered with gold line (silver line) on the top of the official cap of the military uniform (Imperial Japanese Army) formal attire (taireifuku [court dress, full-dress uniform]) that the under-officers put on as the formal attire or the ceremonial dress.

A Gobosei was embroidered with gold line (silver line) on the top of the official cap of the military uniform (Imperial Japanese Army) formal attire (taireifuku [court dress, full-dress uniform]) that the under-officers put on as the formal attire or the ceremonial dress.
sen.cmt: 初出ではないので、"Gobosei" のみでよいと判断しました。
sen.e: A Gobosei was embroidered with gold line (silver line) on the top of the official cap of the military uniform (Imperial Japanese Army) formal attire (taireifuku [court dress, full-dress uniform]) that the under-officers put on as the formal attire or the ceremonial dress.

sen.j: 「陸軍服制」（明治33年勅令第364号）によると、大将から兵卒まで、帝国陸軍の軍帽には五芒星が刺繍されていた。
sen.e: According to the "Army dress code system" (1900 imperial edict No. 364), the Gobosei was embroidered on the caps of the Imperial Army from taisho (general) to soldiers.
According to the "Army dress code system" (1900 imperial edict No. 364), the Gobosei was embroidered on the caps of the Imperial Army from taisho (general) to soldiers.
According to the "Army dress code system" (1900 imperial edict No. 364), the Gobosei was embroidered on the caps of the Imperial Army from taisho (general) to soldiers.

sen.j: 桜花の萼（がく）の形を模しているとも、弾除け（多魔除け）の意味をかついで採用されていたとも言われており、その起源や意味についてははっきりしない。
sen.e: It is said it was designed after the cup of a cherry blossom, or it was adopted, punning "tamayoke" (splinterproof) (the same pronunciation means barrier against multiple evils), but the origin or meaning is not known.
sen.cmt: 弾除け（多魔除け）の語呂合わせは、 punning "tamayoke" (splinterproof) (the same pronunciation means barrier against multiple evils)eとしました。適訳不明。
sen.e: It is said it was designed after the cup of a cherry blossom, or it was adopted, punning "tamayoke" (splinterproof) (the same pronunciation means barrier against multiple evils), but the origin or meaning is not known.

It is said to have been designed after the calyx of a cherry blossom or to have been adopted as a pun based on two possible meanings for "tamayoke" (written as "弾除け," it means bulletproof", but written as "多魔除け," it means "barrier against multiple evils"); however, the word's origin and exact meaning are unknown.

sen.j: また陸軍軍属においても、親任官以下全ての陸軍軍属が着用する軍属従軍服（軍属服）では、五芒星を模した臂章が制式（昭和18年制）であった。
sen.e: Further, in the case of the army civilian employees, the arm mark of civilian employee uniform for campaign (civilian employees' attire) used by all the army civilian employees, including officials appointed by the emperor, was designed after the Gobosei, and it was used as the official style (1943 style).
sen.cmt: 。で区切られていた箇所を訂正しました。軍属→英辞朗を参照しました。従軍軍服はuniform for campaignとしました。
sen.e: Further, in the case of the army civilian employees, the arm mark of civilian employee uniform for campaign (civilian employees' attire) used by all the army civilian employees, including officials appointed by the emperor, was designed after the Gobosei, and it was used as the official style (1943 style).

Furthermore, the army patch on the uniform for military campaigns that was worn by all the army civilian employees, including officials appointed by the emperor, was designed based on the Gobosei, and it was used as the official style (1943 style).

sen.j: 他、背広着用時に佩用するバッジ型（七宝焼き）の徽章でも五芒星が使われていた。
sen.e: In addition, the badge type (cloisonne) mark, worn when they were in business suit, used Gobosei.
In addition, the badge type (cloisonne) mark, worn when they were in business suit, used Gobosei.
In addition, the badge type (cloisonne) mark, worn when they were in business suit, used Gobosei.

sen.j: 歴史的に確認されているもっとも古い五芒星の用法は、紀元前3000年頃のメソポタミアの書物である。
sen.e: The oldest use of the Gobosei (pentacle) mark that was identified in the history is Mesopotamian books around 3000 B.C.
Historically, it is identified the oldest use of the Gobosei was in the Mesopotamian books around 3000 B.C.
sen.cmt: The oldest use is Mesopotamian books は、文法的に不自然に思いましたので、左記のように修正しました。
sen.e: Historically, it is identified the oldest use of the Gobosei was in the Mesopotamian books around 3000 B.C.

sen.j: シュメールはこれをUB（ウブ）と呼んだ。
sen.e: It was called UB in Sumer.
It was called UB in Sumer.
It was called UB in Sumer.

sen.j: さらに下向き五芒星を「角・小さな空間・穴」などの意味を表す絵文字とする。
sen.e: Further, the downward Gobosei was used as the pictogram representing "corner, small space, hole," and so on.
Further, the downward Gobosei was used as the pictogram representing "corner, small space, hole," and so on.
Further, the downward Gobosei was used as the pictogram representing 'corner, small space, hole,' and so on.

sen.j: エジプトでは子宮をあらわさせていたことから性的意味合いがあるとも言われている。
sen.e: As it represents a womb in Egypt, it is said it had a sexual meaning.
As it represents a womb in Egypt, it is said it had a sexual meaning.
As it represents a womb in Egypt, it is said it had a sexual meaning.

sen.j: バビロニアでは、図形の各側面に前後左右と上の各方向を割り当て、それぞれ木星・水星・火星・土星、そして上に地母神イシュタルの現れとされた金星を対応させた。
sen.e: In Babylonia, the forward, backward, left, right, and upward directions were assigned to each side of the figure, representing Jupiter, Mercury, Mars, Saturn, and Venus for the upward, which was believed to represent the appearance of the mother goddess, Ishtar.

In Babylonia, the forward, backward, left, right, and upward directions were assigned to each side of the figure, representing Jupiter, Mercury, Mars, Saturn, and Venus for the upward, which was believed to represent the appearance of the mother goddess, Ishtar.

In Babylonia, the forward, backward, left, right, and upward directions were assigned to each side of the figure, representing Jupiter, Mercury, Mars, Saturn, and Venus for the upward, which was believed to represent the appearance of the mother goddess, Ishtar.

sen.j: 五芒星に五星を対応させる考え方は、後のヨーロッパにも見受けられる。
sen.e: The idea of the Gobosei representing five planets was also seen in later Europe.
The idea of the Gobosei representing five planets was also seen in later Europe.
The idea of the Gobosei representing five planets was also seen in later Europe.

sen.j: また、火・水・風・土の四大元素にエーテル (神学)を加えた五大元素にもそれぞれの頂点が対応させられた。
sen.e: Further, each point was assigned to each of the five elements, which are the four elements of Fire, Water, Wind, and Earth and Ether (theology) added.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Further, each point was assigned to each of the five elements, which are the four elements of Fire, Water, Wind, and Earth and Ether (theology) added.
Further, each point was assigned to each of the five elements, which are the four elements of Fire, Water, Wind, and Earth and Ether (theology) added.

sen.j: それは現在でも魔法などのシンボリズムに使われている。
sen.e: It is used for the symbolism of magic, etc. even today.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is used for the symbolism of magic, etc. even today.
It is used for the symbolism of magic, etc. even today.
